poem:
### Morning Headline

A map unfolds across the breakfast table,  
where borders blur beneath spilled coffee.  
Night's drone has split distant silence,  
as voices rise, shadowed in the morning light.  
We sip headlines, our spoons stirring  
echoes of diplomatic dance—  
a prelude to another day's chorus:  
discord in a world forever poised.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer backs US strike on Iran and calls for Tehran to return to negotiations Keir Starmer has backed the US strike on Iran’s nuclear facilities and called on Iran to return to negotiations, saying the country’s nuclear programme was a “grave threat to international security”. Donald Trump announced overnight that the US has bombed three nuclear sites in Iran, joining Israel’s attack on the regime. There was no UK involvement in the action. Starmer and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
